tn.ref: what was evil in the sight of Yahweh
tn.text: Here "in the sight of Yahweh" represents what Yahweh considers or thinks about something. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jdg:02:11|2:11]]. AT: "what Yahweh said was evil to do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: he gave them into the hand of the Philistines
tn.text: Here "hand" refers to power to defeat in battle. AT: "he allowed the Philistines to defeat them" or "he allowed them to be oppressed by the Philistines" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"40 years" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
This was the name of a town in Israel. It was in the region of Judah near the border of Dan. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
people from the tribe of Dan
This is the name of a man. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This refers to childbirth. AT: "bear a son" or "have a baby boy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Something that Yahweh has stated is unfit to eat is spoken of as if it were physically unclean. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"Pay attention" or "Listen"

tn.ref: No razor will be used upon his head
tn.text: Here the word "head" refers to his hair. This can be stated in active form. AT: "No one should ever cut his hair" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
a sharp knife used to cut hair close to the skin
This means that he will be devoted to God as a Nazirite. AT: "a Nazirite devoted to God" or "devoted to God as a Nazirite" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Here the word "womb" refers to the time before the child is born. AT: "from before he is born" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here the word "hand" means control. AT: "the control of the Philistines" or "being under the Philistine's control" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This means that the man was sent by God. This can be made explicit. AT: "A man that God sent" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: his appearance was like that of an angel of God, very terrible
tn.text: Here "terrible" means "frightening." AT: "I was very afraid of him because he looked like an angel of God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
"Pay attention" or "Listen"
This refers to childbirth. AT: "bear a son" or "have a baby boy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: any food that the law declares to be unclean
tn.text: Something that Yahweh has stated is unfit to eat is spoken of as if it were physically unclean. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

This means that he will be devoted to God as a Nazirite. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jdg:13:03|3:5]]. AT: "a Nazirite devoted to God" or "devoted to God as a Nazirite" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: from the time he is in your womb until the day of his death
tn.text: This emphasizes that it would be for his entire life. AT: "all his life" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
Translate this man's name the same way you did in [[:en:bible:notes:jdg:13:01|13:2]].
You can make explicit the implicit meaning of the author's words. AT: "came to Manoah's wife" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"Listen" or "Pay attention to what I am about to tell you"
This refers to the angel of God in [[:en:bible:notes:jdg:13:03|13:3]]. This can be made explicit. AT: "the man of God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This refers to what the man said. AT: "what you have said" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: anything that comes from the vines
tn.text: Here the angel refers to any food that grow on a vine as "coming" from the vine. AT: "anything that grows on a vine" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: that the law declares to be unclean
tn.text: Something that Yahweh has stated is unfit to eat is spoken of as if it were physically unclean. See how you translated this phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:jdg:13:06|13:7]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: prepare a young goat for you
tn.text: You can make explicit the implicit meaning of Manoah's statement. AT: "cook a young goat for you to eat" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
The phrase "your words" refers to what the angel has said. AT: "what you have said comes true" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: Why do you ask my name?
tn.text: The angel asks this question as a rebuke. This question can be written as a statement. AT: "You should not ask me what my name is." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
It may be helpful to explain more explicitly why they should not ask his name. AT: "It is too wonderful for you to understand" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

This law requires a grain offering to be offered when a burnt offering is made. AT: "with the grain offering required with it" or "with the grain offering to accompany it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"on the altar." The altar Manoah sacrificed the offering on was a rock.
"The angel did something"

tn.ref: the angel of Yahweh went up in the flame of the altar
tn.text: "the angel of Yahweh went back up into heaven through the flames on the altar"
"lay with their faces to the ground." This is a sign of respect and honor, but it also shows their fear of Yahweh. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])

tn.ref: that he was the angel of Yahweh
tn.text: The word "he" refers to the man who Manoah and his wife had seen.

tn.ref: We are sure to die, because we have seen God
tn.text: It is implied that they think God will cause them to die. This can be made clear. AT: "God will cause us to die because we have seen him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: He would not have shown us all these things, nor at this time would he have let us hear such things
tn.text: Manoah's wife said basically the same thing twice for emphasis. These two statements can be combined. AT: "He would not have told us what he wanted us to do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
"Manoah's wife"
This refers to childbirth. AT: "bore a son" or "had a baby boy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"became an adult" or "matured"

tn.ref: Yahweh's Spirit began to stir him
tn.text: Here the way Yahweh's Spirit influences Samson is compared to the way a spoon stirs food in a pot. AT: "Yahweh's Spirit began to influence Samson" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Mahaneh Dan is the name of a temporary camp that the tribe of Dan lived in while they looked for a permanent home. Eshtaol is the name of a town. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Translate the name of this town the same way you did in [[:en:bible:notes:jdg:13:01|13:2]].
